src\\Vibe.UI\\Base\\ClassBuilder.cs::Add.name: AddClass
src\\Vibe.UI\\Base\\ClassBuilder.cs::Add.doc: Adds a user-provided CSS class to the builder. This is useful for allowing consumers to pass custom classes to components. The user-provided CSS class. If null or whitespace, it will be ignored. A new instance with the user class added. // In a component [Parameter] public string? Class { get; set; } protected override string ComponentClass => new ClassBuilder() .Add("vibe-button") .AddVariant("vibe-button", Variant) .AddClass(Class); // Adds user-provided classes

src\\Vibe.UI\\Base\\ClassBuilder.cs::Bui.name: Build
src\\Vibe.UI\\Base\\ClassBuilder.cs::Bui.doc: Builds and returns the final CSS class string. Multiple classes are separated by spaces, and empty/whitespace values are filtered out. A space-separated string of CSS classes, or an empty string if no classes were added. var classString = new ClassBuilder() .Add("vibe-button") .AddIf("vibe-button-disabled", true) .Build(); // Returns "vibe-button vibe-button-disabled"

src\\Vibe.UI\\Base\\ClassBuilder.cs::Add.name: AddWhen
src\\Vibe.UI\\Base\\ClassBuilder.cs::Add.doc: Adds a CSS class to the builder based on a lazy-evaluated condition. The condition function is only evaluated if the builder is being constructed. The CSS class name to add if the condition evaluates to true. A function that returns the condition determining whether the class should be added. A new instance with the class added if the condition evaluates to true. Thrown when is null. var builder = new ClassBuilder() .Add("vibe-button") .AddWhen("vibe-button-icon-only", () => Icon != null && ChildContent == null);

src\\Vibe.UI\\Base\\ClassBuilder.cs::Add.name: AddVariant
src\\Vibe.UI\\Base\\ClassBuilder.cs::Add.doc: Adds a CSS class based on an enum variant value. The class is constructed as "{prefix}-{enumValue}" where the enum value is converted to lowercase. The enum type. Must be an enum. The prefix for the CSS class (e.g., "vibe-button"). The enum value to append to the prefix. A new instance with the variant class added. Thrown when is not an enum type. public enum ButtonVariant { Primary, Secondary, Destructive } public enum ButtonSize { Small, Medium, Large } var builder = new ClassBuilder() .Add("vibe-button") .AddVariant("vibe-button", ButtonVariant.Primary) // Adds "vibe-button-primary" .AddVariant("vibe-button", ButtonSize.Large); // Adds "vibe-button-large"

src\\Vibe.UI.CLI\\Services\\ComponentSer.name: InstallComponentAsync
src\\Vibe.UI.CLI\\Services\\ComponentSer.signature:
InstallComponentAsync(
        string projectPath,
        string componentsDir,
        string componentName,
        bool overwrite = false,
        string? customName = null,
        string? customOutputDir = null)
src\\Vibe.UI.CLI\\Services\\ComponentSer.doc: Makes components easier to discover (no need to remember categories) Reduces cognitive load (no "which category?" decisions) Scales well with modern IDE tooling Examples: // Default flat structure (recommended): await InstallComponentAsync(projectPath, "Components", "button", false); // Result: Components/Button.razor // Custom subdirectory structure: await InstallComponentAsync(projectPath, "Components", "button", false, null, "Components/Input"); // Result: Components/Input/Button.razor Note: The source code in Vibe.UI.CLI is organized by category for maintainer convenience, but components are installed flat by default for user convenience.

src\\Vibe.UI\\Base\\ClassBuilder.cs::Add.name: AddIf
src\\Vibe.UI\\Base\\ClassBuilder.cs::Add.doc: Conditionally adds a CSS class to the builder based on a boolean condition. The CSS class name to add if the condition is true. The condition that determines whether the class should be added. A new instance with the class added if the condition is true. var builder = new ClassBuilder() .Add("vibe-button") .AddIf("vibe-button-disabled", IsDisabled) .AddIf("vibe-button-loading", IsLoading);

src\\Vibe.UI\\Base\\ClassBuilder.cs::Cla.name: ClassBuilder
src\\Vibe.UI\\Base\\ClassBuilder.cs::Cla.doc: The ClassBuilder follows an immutable pattern where each method call returns a new instance with the modified state, making it safe to use across multiple threads and enabling method chaining. Example usage: protected override string ComponentClass => new ClassBuilder() .Add("vibe-button") .AddVariant("vibe-button", Variant) .AddVariant("vibe-button", Size) .AddIf("vibe-button-full-width", FullWidth) .AddIf("vibe-button-loading", Loading) .AddIf("vibe-button-icon-only", Icon != null && ChildContent == null) .AddClass(UserProvidedClass) .Build();
